item.title: MW3 and Warzone Conquest Event: All Challenges and Rewards
item.description:
Season 5 of Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone is in full swing with the developers constantly injecting new content into multiplayer and the battle royale. While the likes of the STG44 assault rifle aim to capitalize on nostalgia, the regular in-game events capture the attention of players looking to get their hands on some free rewards.

Unlike some events that require the community to band together and achieve a specific target, the MW3 and Warzone Conquest Event involves players completing individual objectives in order to claim the rewards that are up for grabs. Here, find all of the challenges and rewards available during the Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone Conquest event.

How To Unlock MW3 And Warzone Conquest Event Rewards

The process of earning rewards during the Conquest event in Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone is straightforward. Players must complete the specified number of challenges across multiplayer, zombies, and the battle royale. Rather than having to complete all three objectives to unlock a single reward, players can select one of the three to earn the prize on offer. When a challenge is active, the progression bar will keep track of how close players are to completing the task.

All MW3 Conquest Event Rewards

Below is a full list of challenges players can complete during the Modern Warfare 3 Conquest event:

Multiplayer Challenges

Warzone Challenges

Zombies Challenges

Reward

Score kills, assists, crossfires, and wins in Free for All matches

Deploy Redeploy Drone Beacons during matches

Earn Convoy Keycards, open Stronghold Safes, loot Merc Camps, or Kill Mercs

Holo-Graphic-Violence Calling Card

Score kills, assists, and wins in Team Deathmatch matches

Earn cards from Biometric Scanners

Kill Hellhounds, Disciples, Mimics, or Manglers in the yellow zone

Inside the Net Emblem

Score kills, assists, objective captures, and wins in Domination matches

Complete Scavenger contracts in Battle Royale or Resurgence matches

Kill zombies in the red zone

Don't Be Afraid of the Dark Decal

Score kills, assists, dog tags, and wins in Kill Confirmed matches

Activate UAV Towers

Complete at least one contract in all difficulty regions and exfil regions without being downed or complete at least five contracts and exfil successfully

Battle Pass Tier Skip

Score kills, assists, objectives, and wins in Hardpoint matches

Purchase Loadout Drops at Buy Stations during matches

Use the Pack-A-Punch machine or exfil with any Aether Tool or Aetherium Crystal

Death's Match Weapon Charm

Score Finishing Moves, assists, downs, and wins in Slam Deathmatch matches

Trade Legendary weapons using a Weapon Trade Station

Score kills with a pistol, SMG, or a melee weapon

All that Follows Weapon Sticker

How To Unlock Locked And Lucky SVA 545 Blueprint

In addition to a wide selection of weapon charms, emblems, and calling cards, players can earn a weapon blueprint for the SVA 545 assault rifle, a weapon that's hovered near the top of the meta for the majority of Season 5. To obtain the Locked and Loaded blueprint, players must complete all six challenges in the Conquest event .

Modern Warfare 3 And Warzone Conquest Event Start Date

The Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone Conquest event started on August 7, 2024, and will run until August 14, 2024 . Players only have seven days to unlock all of the rewards that are on offer so make sure to focus on the challenges before they expire for good.

item.title: LEGO 2K Drive Codes (August 2024)
item.description:
LEGO 2K Drive is a fun racing game that has become a great addition to the collection of LEGO games. Although players have repeatedly had the opportunity to drive LEGO cars in other games, like Forza Horizon 4 expansion, this game is fully dedicated to the theme and has many cool innovations and events that will not let players get bored. The game has many modes, events, a story, and a constructor in which you can create your own car, so you will always have something to do whenever you enter the game.

Even if you're not a LEGO fan, the game is still worth a try because the most important aspect of the game, driving, is well done and brings a lot of fun. If you don't want to build your own car, you can always buy a ready-made one, copy it from someone else, or get it for free using LEGO 2K Drive codes.

All LEGO 2K Drive Codes

Working LEGO 2K Drive Codes

  • AFVJY5OK - Enter this code to get a Race Car.

Expired LEGO 2K Drive Codes

There are currently no expired codes for LEGO 2K Drive . The code above has been active for many months, so players will likely be able to receive rewards for a long time.

In LEGO 2K Drive , you can buy cars, build them yourself, or copy them from other players. However, each of these methods has its drawbacks, so players are often looking for alternative methods to replenish their fleet. One of them is codes, using which you can get a cool racing car for free.

How to Redeem Codes in LEGO 2K Drive

If you have redeemed codes in mobile games or Roblox experiences, you probably know that it is usually very easy to do so. However, on PC and console games, this feature is quite rare and often confusing for players. In LEGO 2K Drive , it's still easy to redeem codes, but there are some nuances that you should know beforehand. That is why we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in LEGO 2K Drive .

  • To redeem codes in LEGO 2K Drive , you need to have a 2K account, so if you don't have one yet, create it.
  • Launch the game and link your 2K account when prompted.
  • When you get to the main menu, go to the Unkie's Emporium tab. After that, wait for a short download.
  • Find the Redeem Code button in the lower-left corner of the screen.
  • In the white box, paste the code from the list of working codes and click Accept.

How to Get More LEGO 2K Drive Codes

To get more codes, bookmark this page in your browser. Similar to Roblox codes, we regularly update this guide so you can always find new working codes here.

item.title: Helldivers 2: 7 Best Star Wars Mods
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 mods bring Star Wars into the game, from iconic characters like Din Djarin to legendary Clone Troopers.
  • Players can immerse themselves in the Star Wars universe with mods replacing enemies, ships, and weapons in Helldivers 2.
  • The modding community's creativity shines in bringing Star Wars elements into Helldivers 2, enhancing the gameplay experience.

Helldivers 2 is a universe that deserves a collab with Star Wars . Whilst the game has had no collabs as of yet, the potential for Star Wars has never been greater, and as such, modders have taken it upon themselves to bring the galaxy far, far away into the Helldivers 2 world, populating it with iconic Star Wars villains, troopers, and weapons to make for an immersive Star Wars experience.

The best Star Wars mods in Helldivers 2 really bring forth the galaxy-spanning war of the Clone Troopers, Separatist Droids, and other iconic themes of battle and weaponry that make Star Wars so great. With these mods, players can make Helldivers 2 a Star Wars fan-project.

7 Din Djarin (The Mandalorian)

Downloads: 5,620

  • Mod Creator: Irastris
  • Mod Link

Din Djarin is the iconic Mandalorian who fathers Grogu and led the siege to retake Mandalore after the fall of the Empire. Din Djarin is an incredible character in the Star Wars universe, and the titular Mandalorian now enters into the company of Super Earth. Hopefully, they’re paying good credits and Beskar Steel if he’s risking his life.

This outfit looks incredible and fits right in for Helldivers 2 ’s best armor sets. To obtain this armor, players will see a replacement in the model of the FS-05 Marksman armor and helmet set, as well as the invisible replacement for the Liberty Herald cape.

6 Star Wars Enemies (Automaton Replacers)

Downloads: 17,113

  • Mod Creator: Kboy, Irastris
  • Mod Link

The Automaton faction is deadly and intimidating, but this mod will replace their armies entirely with B1/B2 Battle Droids, Droidekas, and far more Star Wars enemies. The Automaton Replacers mod is perhaps the best Star Wars mod in Helldivers 2 , as it replaces the entire faction of robots with the Separatist droids, providing a gateway into the Star Wars universe as Clones battle it out against Droids.

With this mod, every fight will feel like something out of the Clone Wars, and fighting clankers feels extremely rewarding and satisfying here, proving that Helldivers 2 is the game for Star Wars players to enjoy as they embrace the Clone Wars.

5 Star Wars Ships (Super Destroyer and Extraction Shuttle Replacers)

Downloads: 27,340

  • Mod Creator: Kboy, Irastris
  • Mod Link

Whilst players do not get to fly ships in Helldivers 2 , they are important set pieces that help to create layers of immersion in the game. Each player has their own dedicated ship, and this mod will replace said ship with Star Destroyers from the Republic era. Every ship in orbit will feature this design, showcasing the grand scale of the Republic over Super Earth.

The other addition to this mod is the fact that the escape ship, Pelican-1, is replaced with a Republic Gunship. The detail on the models looks great, and it shows the boundless imagination and concepts that the fan community can come up with.

4 Commando

Downloads: 662

  • Mod Creator: HighEndJungle
  • Mod Link

Whilst Clone Troopers lead the charge against the Separatists, it’s the Clone Commandos who get the most respect. These elite variants of the Clone Troopers have been genetically altered and trained to commit themselves to the most dangerous Black Ops missions, and they fit perfectly in with the aesthetic of Helldivers 2 ’s most elite squads.

With the Commando mod, players can become a Clone Commando, running around the battlefield to destroy bugs and bots alike as one of the elite units of the Grand Republic’s army of millions of soldiers, taking on the role of one of their best.

3 Laser Blaster Sound Effect

Downloads: 506

  • Mod Creator: Exoterminator
  • Mod Link

The sound design for Helldivers 2 is incredible and really helps to bring the alien worlds and dangers to life. Yet, there are some ways that players can bring forth Star Wars into the sound, and a mod by Exoterminator does just that, allowing players to enjoy some sound effects from iconic blaster weapons across various Star Wars films and games.

With the Laser Blaster Sound Effect, the players’ guns will have audio replacements, which really combines well with other mods to help make an immersive Star Wars simulator where war ravishes multiple worlds.

2 DC-17M Star Wars Republic Commando

Downloads: 489

  • Mod Creator: StringyBean6
  • Mod Link

This mod replaces the SMG Defender with a DC-17m which is seen in use by Clone Commandos. The model looks good, and the sci-fi aesthetic lends itself to the space fantasy of Star Wars mixed with Helldivers 2 .

The mod pairs great with sound effects mods and outfit mods, bringing forth the gear and cosmetics that players need to bring the Star Wars action directly to them in Helldivers 2 . Hopefully, more iconic Star Wars weapons make their way into the modding scene.

1 Clone Trooper (Phase 2 – 501st Legion)

Downloads: 27,056

  • Mod Creator: Kboy
  • Mod Link

One of the earliest mods in Helldivers 2 still remains one of its best. This Clone Trooper mod allows players to enter into the deadly battlefield of Helldivers 2 as a Clone Trooper wearing Anakin Skywalker’s 501st trooper armor. Adorned with the blue colors responsible for Order 66’s Jedi Temple Purge, this outfit is one of the more iconic ones to take into the fight.

The mod acts as a replacement for a variant of the B-01 Tactical armor and helmet and even provides an invisible cape to wear so that nothing gets in the way. For cosmetics, it’s a fun mod and just the beginning of what’s possible with Helldivers 2 mods.

item.title: One New Monster Hunter Wilds Creature Could be the Game's Khezu
item.description:
Highlights

  • Monster Hunter Wilds introduces new, eerie monster designs like Balahara, following the trend set by the creepy Khezu creature.
  • The eyeless serpentine swimmer, Balahara, brings a formidable challenge with its insectoid features and desert setting traps.
  • The latest addition to MH's eyeless creatures is likely to resonate with players, offering a scary yet lasting impact in the series.

Monster Hunter Wilds is set to introduce players to a new world seemingly filled with fresh monster concepts, but one of the designs revealed so far might fall under the category of the franchise's most bizarre creatures. While it's always been known as a series that pushes the boundaries of imaginative yet somehow practical monsters that come along with each entry, several of them have become defined by their particularly unsettling looks. Now that one of these monsters has already been shown off in one of the first looks at Monster Hunter Wilds ' gameplay, it's possible that it could end up embodying a similar role to the grotesque MH creature that began this pattern.

The designs initially revealed in Wilds ' first trailers were the likes of relatively predictable Herbivores and Fanged Beasts, but a unique Monster Hunter Leviathan stood out against these more conventional archetypes. Known as the Balahara, this monster is a serpentine swimmer of sand dunes, bearing stout limbs and what appears to be an eyeless, worm-like face. Apart from featuring a far more intimidating look than players are accustomed to at the start of a playthrough, this monster could be the latest addition to a lineage of strange and eerie creatures that began with the Khezu.

Khezu Set the Tone for Creepy Designs in Monster Hunter

The Evolution of Eyeless Monsters

Debuting in Monster Hunter Freedom Unite , the Khezu was a departure from the more traditionally mythical and majestic wildlife inspirations of monsters up until that point. Lacking eyes on a face resembling that of a leech, this drooling, cave-prowling take on a Flying Wyvern has persisted as one of MH 's most memorable creatures. Through its unique association with wall-clinging and electricity being emphasized since its introduction, the Khezu also laid the groundwork for Capcom to iterate on this concept moving forward.

Despite the uncomfortable appearance of a mysterious monster lacking eyes, it's likely that the subsequent appearances of Monster Hunter 3 's Gigginox and the popular Gore Magala within the following generations wouldn't have been possible without Khezu beginning this trend. That original creepy monster seems to have outlived those other creatures for now following its outing in Rise , but it also seems that the next game in the series is bringing its own twist on this formula to the table.

Balahara's Uncanny Features Could Mean Its Monster Hunter Wilds' New Khezu

While it may still be unknown which classic designs will be returning to the bestiary of Monster Hunter Wilds , it's clear that the Balahara is encroaching on much of the same territory already covered by the likes of Khezu and its successors. Its apparent hunting behavior of setting traps similar to Antlions paired with its mandible-like, tripartite jaws evokes an insectoid feeling, but this is a full-sized monster that offers a formidable challenge within its desert home. Between a heavy reliance on its environment and the disturbing aesthetic of its serrated jaws and glowing flesh, the Balahara is likely taking heavily after the niche established by the Khezu.

There may still be room for the cave-dwelling Wyvern to exist in Wilds though, as the Balahara has been shown to operate in groups as opposed to the solitary behavior of Monster Hunter 's influential Khezu. With it only having been seen in packs so far, there's even the potential for a greater Balahara leader that can function as a proper boss in the same vein as creepier monsters of the past. Regardless of the variations that may follow it, however, the latest addition to MH 's set of eyeless creatures which represent some of the scariest parts of the entire series is sure to remind many returning players of the lasting impact of one of the series' most horrific concepts.

item.title: Modern Warfare 3 Players Want This Classic Call of Duty Map Put Back in Rotation
item.description:
Highlights

  • Call of Duty fans are frustrated over the removal of the Estate map from Modern Warfare 3 playlists.
  • Modern Warfare 3 was criticized and review bombed for its short campaign, with many calling it a "glorified DLC" for Modern Warfare 2.
  • Players are asking for more equal weighting of classic maps like Estate in the multiplayer rotation.

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 fans are eager to know why one of the series' most iconic maps has seemingly been pulled from the majority of the game's playlists. When Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 was released in 2023, one of the shooter's main selling points was that it would include a plethora of remastered multiplayer maps from the original Modern Warfare 2 , so fans want to know why one of these maps no longer gets the love it deserves.

While Call of Duty fans absolutely love its fast-paced multiplayer, Modern Warfare 3 was review-bombed at launch due to the game's short and lackluster campaign. It currently has one of the worst Metacritic scores out of every Call of Duty game, with a popular critique being that Modern Warfare 3 is a "glorified DLC" for 2022's Modern Warfare 2 . This argument is further fueled by the fact that at the game's launch, all of the included multiplayer maps were remasters.

As Modern Warfare 3 continues to receive new seasonal content, fans often find it difficult to keep up with what maps are being weighted more in the game's multiplayer rotation. However, one eagle-eyed user on the Modern Warfare 3 subreddit has pointed out that one classic map seems to no longer be in most of the game's playlists. Reddit user Demon5572 has alerted fans to the disappearance of Estate, an extremely popular map that first appeared in 2009's Modern Warfare 2 , as fans say they are sick of the newer reskins and want the classics to make a return.

Modern Warfare 3 Fans Frustrated as Estate Removed From Rotation

Initially, the Reddit user stated that Estate had been completely removed from Modern Warfare 3 's map rotation, but further investigation by other users found that the map still exists in Search and Destroy and Cutthroat. Thankfully, it's easy enough to see which maps are in rotation as fans can simply select the information button on any given playlist to see which maps are included.

Activision might be hard at work banning thousands of Modern Warfare 3 cheaters, but players want answers as to why Estate is barely in the game's map rotation anymore. In response to Demon5572's post, Reddit user RyuzakiL117 explained that they don't like when maps are removed from the game's rotation. They went on to explain that they believe all maps should be weighted equally, including the classic maps, such as Estate, as they were one of the main selling points for Modern Warfare 3 . As for Reddit user Storvox, they say they're "sick" of playing re-skinned versions of the same map over and over again.

Season 5 of Modern Warfare 3 didn't just include a WWE crossover, but also saw various multiplayer maps such as Rust, Shipment, and Stash House receive cel-shaded variants. While these new versions remained identical in terms of layout, the overall aesthetic was more reminiscent of something from Borderlands. Though it seems clear that fans don't want to keep receiving reskins of the same few maps, they also want to see classic maps like Estate appear more often.
